abstract: Third grade student Ikeoluwa Opayemi, of Milford, Conn, has not been allowed in class since she returned from a 10-day trip to Nigeria, due to Ebola fears; her family files discrimination lawsuit against school district, which imposed 21-day quarantine, accusing it of violating Americans with Disabilities Act.
lead_paragraph: Amid continued fears of Ebola, the student, Ikeoluwa Opayemi, has not been allowed in class since she returned from a 10-day trip to Nigeria.

byline.contributor: Kristin Hussey contributed reporting from Milford, Conn.

headline.main: After a Family Trip to Africa, a Connecticut Girl, 7, Is Unwelcome at School
headline.print_headline: After a Family Trip to Africa, a Connecticut Girl, 7, Is Unwelcome at School
headline.seo: Amid Ebola Fears, School Bars a Third-Grader for 21 Days

snippet: Amid continued fears of Ebola, the student, Ikeoluwa Opayemi, has not been allowed in class since she returned from a 10-day trip to Nigeria....
